articles.title: Introducing GPT-5
articles.description: We are introducing GPT‑5, our best AI system yet. GPT‑5 is a significant leap in intelligence over all our previous models, featuring state-of-the-art performance across coding, math, writing, health, visual perception, and more.

articles.title: Amazon Devices & Services Achieves Major Step Toward Zero-Touch Manufacturing With NVIDIA AI and Digital Twins
articles.description: Using NVIDIA digital twin technologies, Amazon Devices & Services is powering big leaps in manufacturing with a new physical AI software solution. Deployed this month at an Amazon Devices facility, the company’s innovative, simulation-first approach for zero-touch manufacturing trains robotic arms to inspect diverse devices for product-quality auditing and integrate new goods into the production Read Article

articles.title: Elastic joins AWS Zero Trust Accelerator for Government (ZTAG) program
articles.description: Elastic is proud to be officially recognized as an AWS Zero Trust for Government partner and for onboarding into the AWS Zero Trust Accelerator for Government (ZTAG) program in the US. By integrating Elastic’s data-centric approach with AWS’s Zero trust framework, this partnership empowers US federal agencies to accelerate and operationalize their Zero Trust adoption efforts.The release and timing of any features or functionality described in this post remain at Elastic's sole discretion. Any...

articles.title: OpenAI’s GPT-5 Announcement: What You Need to Know
articles.description: This post attempts to consolidate key details from OpenAI’s GPT-5 announcement alongside early reactions from users and industry observers. Presented in a question-and-answer format, it examines the model’s technical specifications, pricing structure, access tiers, safety enhancements, and validated enterprise use cases. The analysis also captures initial community responses, which range from praise for improved accuracyContinue reading "OpenAI’s GPT-5 Announcement: What You Need to Know" The...

articles.title: What’s coming up at #IJCAI2025?
articles.description: The IJCAI-25 logo and theme photo (cropped). Credit: IJCAI. The 34rd International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence (IJCAI-25) will be held in Montréal, Canada from 16-22 August. The programme will feature keynote talks, tutorials, workshops, competitions, and oral and poster presentations. There will also be four special tracks, focussing on: AI for social good, AI […]

articles.title: Signal Through the Noise: An AI Product Builder’s Guide
articles.description: As AI capabilities rapidly advance, the challenge for product teams has shifted from “what can we build?” to “what should we build?” The following insights, drawn from recent conversations with AI founders, successful product launches, and emerging security research, offer practical guidance for teams designing AI applications that users will actually adopt and trust. 1.Continue reading "Signal Through the Noise: An AI Product Builder’s Guide" The post Signal Through the Noise: An AI Product...

articles.title: Learning How to Vote with Principles: Axiomatic Insights Into the Collective Decisions of Neural Networks
articles.description: Can neural networks be applied in voting theory, while satisfying the need for transparency in collective decisions? We propose axiomatic deep voting: a framework to build and evaluate neural networks that aggregate preferences, using the well-established axiomatic method of voting theory. Our findings are: (1) Neural networks, despite being highly accurate, often fail to align with the core axioms of voting rules, revealing a disconnect between mimicking outcomes and reasoning. (2) Training...
articles.author: Levin Hornischer, Zoi Terzopoulou
articles.content: Can neural networks be applied in voting theory, while satisfying the need for transparency in collective decisions? We propose axiomatic deep voting: a framework to build and evaluate neural networks that aggregate preferences, using the well-established axiomatic method of voting theory. Our findings are: (1) Neural networks, despite being highly accurate, often fail to align with the core axioms of voting rules, revealing a disconnect between mimicking outcomes and reasoning. (2) Training...

articles.title: Argumentative Reasoning in ASPIC+ under Incomplete Information
articles.description: Reasoning under incomplete information is an important research direction in the study of computational argumentation. Most advances in this direction so far have focused on abstract argumentation frameworks. In particular, development of computational approaches to reasoning under incomplete information in structured formalisms remains to a large extent a challenge. We address this challenge by studying the problems of determining stability and relevance—with the aim of analyzing aspects of...
articles.author: Daphne Odekerken, Tuomo Lehtonen, Johannes P. Wallner, Matti Järvisalo
articles.content: Reasoning under incomplete information is an important research direction in the study of computational argumentation.
